item.value: The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon. He, Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin and Michael Collins were the crew of Apollo 11.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Microsoft Windows was announced November 10, 1983.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
There are more than 2,700 languages ( + more than 7,000 dialects) in the world. More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics was won by Albert Einstein for his work in the field of theoretical physics.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
Elephants demonstrate concern for members of their families they take care of weak or injured members and appear to grieve over a dead companion.
